channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Credit Cards Don't Require Signatures. So Why Do We Still Sign?
item.description: Putting your John Hancock on receipts has been optional since 2018, even on restaurant checks.

item.title: Is the stock market open on Columbus Day? Are banks and post offices closed?
item.description: Monday is both Columbus Day and Indigenous Peoples’ Day, and many services will be closed or running with modified hours

item.title: Nvidia’s stock secures first record in four months as customers seem locked in
item.description: One analyst says customers are in a “prisoner’s dilemma” that will keep them spending, while another was encouraged by recent Nvidia commentary on the...

item.title: Oil prices lose 2% after China offers little detail on stimulus plans
item.description: Oil futures ended lower Monday to give back all of last week’s gains and then some, after a weekend announcement by Chinese authorities failed to prov...

item.title: ‘No one writes about “rich guy” early retirement’: My wife and I earn $300,000 a year and have $3.75 million. We have 3 kids. When can I quit working?
item.description: “I’ve been lucky to have a terrific job in finance for the past 25 years.”

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold futures lose some ground, with the front-month contract finishing down 0.4% to $2,657.80 an ounce.

item.title: The bull market is entering its 3rd year. Here’s what history says will happen next.

item.description: U.S. natural gas futures fell sharply as production picked up with little near-term weather-driven demand seen beyond a cold shot expected midweek int...

item.title: Nasdaq Leads Gains; Dow Closes Above 43000
item.description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq added 0.8% and 0.9%, respectively. The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 0.5%. Oil prices fell after China failed to provide de...

item.title: Citi Sees Possibility of $120 Oil if Supplies Are Disrupted
item.description: Crude oil prices could jump if supplies are disrupted by conflict in the Middle East, analysts at Citi Research said.
